intro: Millspaughia antigonoides, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are showy, with five petals, and are usually pink or red in color.
